Key Match Events: Sanju Samson failed to convert his start again but showed his class in his knock of 29 off 19.
Suryakumar Yadav hit a six off Taskin Ahmed in the fourth over, and later hit a six off Mustafizur Rahman in the sixth over.
Abhishek Sharma scored 16 off 7 balls, but was run out in the first over.
Hardik Pandya finished the game with 39 off 16 balls, killing the game with 49 balls remaining and 7 wickets in hand.
Arshdeep Singh took 3 wickets, and Varun Chakaravarthy also took 3 wickets.
Bangladesh scored 127/10 in 19.5 overs, with Najmul Hossain Shanto scoring 65 and Mehidy Hasan scoring 35.
Pre-Game Insights: India won the toss and elected to bowl first.
Bangladesh did not start well, losing their openers inside the Powerplay.
Bangladesh struggled to construct partnerships and kept losing wickets, slipping to 111/7 by the end of the 16th over.
Bangladesh scored 39/2 in the Powerplay, but couldn't get the required momentum in the latter part of the innings.
India's bowlers, particularly Arshdeep Singh and Varun Chakaravarthy, bowled well, reducing Bangladesh to just above a run-a-ball.
Post-Match Reflections: Suryakumar Yadav said they just tried to back their skills and tried to walk the talk. He appreciated debutants Mayank Yadav and Nitish Kumar Reddy.

Najmul Hossain Shanto, the Bangladesh captain, said they did not start well, adding that in T20s it is important to play well in the Powerplay but they didn't. He mentioned that the plan was to bat positively but they also need to adjust according to the situation.
Arshdeep Singh was named the Player of the Match for his brilliant bowling spell. He mentioned that he made minor changes like with his wrists or fingers to bring in the variations.

Varun Chakaravarthy said it felt like a rebirth for him to be back in the blues after 3 long years. He added that he just wanted to stick to the process and that's what he tried to do in the Indian T20 League earlier this year.
Miscellaneous Highlights: India took the early lead in the series with Bangladesh having their task cut out now.
Hardik Pandya finished the game with 39 off 16 balls, killing the game with 49 balls remaining and 7 wickets in hand.
Bangladesh posted a below-par total with only Najmul Hossain Shanto and Mehidy Hasan crossing the 20-run mark.
Arshdeep Singh and Varun Chakaravarthy were the pick of the bowlers for India with three wickets each.
